narrative.title: 25 Divisione Di Fanteria Bologna - 1941Q1

situation.formation_date: Peacetime formation, activated for war service 1940
situation.deployment_history: Deployed to Libya June 1940, garrisoned Tripolitania. Participated in Italian invasion of Egypt September 1940 (advance to Sidi Barrani). Suffered heavily during British Operation Compass (December 1940-January 1941). By Q1 1941 significantly weakened but still operational in defensive role.
situation.operational_status_1941q1: Combat-worn, reduced strength, defensive operations, severe supply limitations, morale reduced after defeats
situation.notes: US G-2 source states division 'Suffered heavily in British advance in 1941' - this refers to Operation Compass (December 1940-February 1941). Division eventually destroyed in Egypt November 1942. Binary division with 2 infantry regiments. AS-type semi-motorized organization. Home station Naples for division HQ, with regiments from Caserta and Naples metropolitan area.

narrative.axis_objective: Maintain defensive positions and inflict maximum casualties on Allied forces.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and secure strategic objectives while minimizing casualties.
